headline: Kraft Heinz Is Evaluating Strategic Transactions
summary: The food company also said two directors representing Berkshire Hathaway would step down from its board.

raw.headline: Kraft Heinz Is Evaluating Strategic Transactions
raw.summary: The food company also said two directors representing Berkshire Hathaway would step down from its board.

headline: Kraft Heinz looking at M&A opportunities; Berkshire Hathaway leaves board
summary: The company also said Timothy Kenesey and Alicia Knapp, executives at Berkshire Hathaway-owned companies, were leaving its board of directors after Warren Buffett's conglomerate said it would no longer hold board seats.  Kraft Heinz has been looking for potential merger and acquisition opportunities "over the past several months", chief executive officer Carlos Abrams-Rivera said in a statement.  Tariffs were also adding to Kraft's woes as it lowered its annual organic sales and profit forecasts last month.

raw.headline: Kraft Heinz looking at M&A opportunities; Berkshire Hathaway leaves board

Tariffs were also adding to Kraft's woes as it lowered its annual organic sales and profit forecasts last month.

headline: The Kraft Heinz Company Announces Ongoing Evaluation of Strategic Transactions to Unlock Shareholder Value
summary: PITTSBURGH & CHICAGO, May 20, 2025--The Kraft Heinz Company (Nasdaq: KHC) ("Kraft Heinz" or the "Company") today announced that the Company’s Board of Directors and Executive Leadership Team have been evaluating potential strategic transactions to unlock shareholder value.

headline: Kraft Heinz to explore ‘strategic transactions’ as sales decline
summary: The ketchup and Jell-O maker did not provide details or a timetable for a decision in its announcement on Tuesday.

headline: Oscar Mayer’s Fleet of Wienermobiles Go Head-to-Head in Inaugural "Wienie 500" – First Ever, High-Stakes Race on the Iconic Indianapolis Motor Speedway
summary: CHICAGO & PITTSBURGH, May 20, 2025--Today, Oscar Mayer announces the "Wienie 500" – a first-of-its-kind spectacle where the fleet of Wienermobiles will haul buns to the legendary Indianapolis Motor Speedway for a race unlike any other. Ahead of this year’s Indianapolis 500, which draws more than 330,000 fans who consume nearly 30,000 hot dogs, Oscar Mayer’s beloved Hotdoggers will make their racing debut on the very same track as the pros. The race will be streamed live on Friday, May 23 at 2pm
